content:
• Wednesday, July 2, 2014
  • TBRA

    Regado -40.5% AH on DSMB review of Regulate-PCI data

    • Regado (RGDO) states the Data Safety Monitoring Board "has initiated an unplanned review of data" for its Regulate-PCI Phase 3 trial.
    • Patient enrolllment  has been paused while the DSMB conducts a review focused on "serious adverse events related to allergic reactions." Its recommendations are expected in the next 8 weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 PM | 5 Comments

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

     

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: DRL +3.8%. VRS +3.1%. WPRT +2.7%. BLDP +2.4%. YNDX +2.2%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BIND -15.8%. STRP -2.4%. SNX -1.8%. ZAGG -1.8%. USU -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • GPRO

    Shorts pile into GoPro

    • "Although still early days, data from SunGard’s Astec Analytics shows the cost of borrowing GoPro (GPRO -13.9%) shares ... has immediately become one of the highest on our system," says analyst Karl Loomes.
    • He adds GoPro's utilization level (the % of shares available on level that are being borrowed) is near 100%. "It wouldn't surprise me if this is a bet against the immediate increase in share price, and not necessarily a bet against the company."
    • Is this a repeat of Twitter? Shorts borrowed virtually every Twitter share they could find (often at high rates) as the microblogging service blasted off following last fall's IPO. Short-squeezes helped drive shares nearly to $75, but those who didn't cover made out well.
    • Earlier: GoPro sees profit-taking
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 6 Comments
  • ATLS

    Atlas Energy +2% as RBC starts at Outperform on strong distribution outlook

    • Atlas Energy (OTC:ATLS +2.1%) is initiated with an Outperform rating and $55 price target at RBC, which believes ATLS can maintain a top-tier distribution growth over the next few years even if underlying MLP distribution growth is below expectations due to IDRs in the deep splits and significant future equity needs at both.
    • Also, RBC starts the Atlas Pipeline (APL -0.1%) MLP at Sector Perform with a $36 target, seeing low-to-mid single-digit distribution growth through the next several years due to expected strong volume growth on its systems but offset by equity capital needs and a future preferred equity conversion, factors which likely will keep a lid on distribution growth through the forecast period.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • CBAK-OLD

    China BAK +40% after LG Chem's deal for electric car battery factory in China

    • China BAK Battery (CBAK-OLD +39.8%) shares are soaring, perhaps related to a WSJ article out this morning which discussed South Korea's LG Chem looking to invest hundreds of millions of dollars in building an electric-car battery factory in China, which may begin production in 2015.
    • The move by LG Chem comes as automakers are rushing to introduce electric vehicles in China, driven by the government's plan to put 500K such vehicles on the road by 2015 and 5M by 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 6 Comments
  • RAX

    TechCrunch walks back Rackspace going-private story

    • "We've tried to make clear that we're reporting an unconfirmed source here, but an interesting angle nonetheless," says TechCrunch, updating this morning's story suggesting Rackspace (RAX +6.4%) is in talks with a P-E firm about taking itself private.
    • Far more skeptical, Dealreporter says it received a note with similar wording to that of the TechCrunch story, but didn't believe the source.
    • Though off the highs a bit, Rackspace nevertheless continues to post a sharp gain on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • DRL

    Doral Financial soars after court victory

    • The Court of First Instance originally ruled it had no jurisdiction to hear Doral's (DRL +58.3%) suit against the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico and the Puerto Rico Treasury over a $229M tax refund Doral says it is owed. Yesterday the Court of Appeals unanimously reversed the Court of First Instance's ruling, and ordered it to quickly hold an evidentiary hearing in which the Treasury Department will have the burden of proof.
    • Previously: Doral Financial takes case to Supreme Court
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • SBGL

    Stillwater Mining +3% as BB&T calls it an attractive takeover target

    • Stillwater Mining (SWC +2.9%) marches higher after a BB&T research note calls the company an attractive takeover target, citing a favorable cash position, geopolitical footprint and improving cost curve.
    • To support this, the firm says management is confident it will reach its cost-cutting goal of $100/oz. within 18 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • STWD

    Starwood recoups portion of yesterday's loss

    • Starwood Property Trust (STWD +1.8%) tumbled yesterday on a report New York Department of Financial Services chief Ben Lawsky had turned his investigatory attention to servicers of CMBS, of which Starwood is a sizable one.
    • DFS spokesperson Matt Anderson tells Bloomberg the report is false.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • EXC

    Exelon says power restored to most of 400K ComEd customers hit by storm

    • Exelon (EXC -3.5%) has shed 5.5% in the past two days after storms with hurricane force winds swept through Commonwealth Edison's territory in the central U.S., knocking out power to as many as 427K customers.
    • The National Weather Service says five tornadoes touched down in Illinois during storm.
    • Based on past storms of similar magnitude, EXC estimates remaining customers will have their service restored by late Thursday night, with the exception of some pockets in hardest hit areas.
    • In southeast Michigan, ~140K DTE Energy (DTE -1.6%) customers lost power at the height of the storm.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu continues rally on Needham PT hike, Kardashian game strength

    • Needham has hiked its Glu Mobile (GLUU +3.2%) PT by $1 to $7, while reiterating a Strong Buy.
    • The PT hike come as Kim Kardashian: Hollywood (previous) continues to perform well on iOS and (to a lesser extent) Android. One week in, the game is #4 and #5 on App Annie's rankings for free and top-grossing iPhone apps, and #25 and #33 on its rankings for free and top-grossing Google Play apps. It's #3 on rankings for new free Google Play Apps.
    • Last Friday: Benchmark upgrades Glu to Buy
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 8 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: EVRY +67%. CBAK-OLD +55%. USU +48%. DRL +33%. VITC +27%. ZGNX +19%. STEM +16%. LTBR +16%. SFLY +14%. OTC:ACFN +13%.
    • Top 10 Losers: EAC -13%. CAMP -11%. GPRO -11%. AMPH -10%. HDY -9%. VJET -9%. MCP -9%. OTC:CRRS -8%. ADGE -8%. DGSE -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • ICLD

    InterCloud higher after announcing $850K in projects

    • InterCloud (ICLD +2%) has obtained over $500K worth of projects from 20 school districts in Indiana and Illinois, and $350K worth of projects in Illionois, Arizona, and Canada.
    • The projects are expected to be finished by year's end.
    • Previous: InterCloud gains on new services contract
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • MLM

    Infrastructure stocks slip as federal highway funds in jeopardy

    • Shares of companies that rely on federal infrastructure investment are lower after the Obama administration warns that federal funding for bridge and highway repair would be curtailed beginning Aug. 1 without congressional action.
    • The current two-year law authorizing federal road spending expires in September, a deadline that can be extended.
    • Martin Marietta (NYSE:MLM), which announced earlier that it had completed its acquisition of Texas Industries, -2.9%; also, EXP -1.6%, VMC -1.3%, GVA -0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 9 Comments
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile +10.8% on annual report filing rumor

    • A rumor that NQ Mobile (NQ) will soon file its delayed annual report (expected to be accompanied by an audit report) has led shares to surge above $7. A NQ spokesperson tells Bloomberg the company has no new information on the report for now.
    • This is a good time to remember 14.4M shares were shorted as of June 13.
    • Last Friday: NQ Mobile makes fresh 52-week lows
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 5 Comments
  • XSPA

    Vringo gains after USPTO confirms validity of '420 patent

    • Vringo (VRNG +4.8%) says it has been mailed a notice by the USPTO stating "it will issue a certificate confirming that all of the claims of U.S. Patent No. 6,314,420 remain valid and unchanged."
    • The '420 patent is one of two being asserted by Vringo in its suit against Google. The USPTO affirmed the validity of the other one (Vringo's '664 patent) last fall.
    • The notice follows a non-final rejection by the USPTO of certain claims within the '420 patent back in January.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • JPM

    Splitting of CEO and chairman role back on agenda at JPMorgan?

    • "For the board to put the company in a position where there isn't a defined leader or replacement if Jamie Dimon were unable to function would be unacceptable," says Dick Bove, arguing it behooves JPMorgan (JPM -1.2%) to split the chairman and CEO roles, given Dimon's medical condition.
    • JPMorgan spokesperson Joseph Evangelisti says the board has in place a short-term, medium-term, and long-term succession plan for Dimon.
    • Were the bank to split the roles, says Bove, the board would likely pick from its current set of independent directors, and a member of the audit committee could be in the best shape to become chairman. Among those is audit committee chair Laban Jackson, a longtime Banc One director who came to JPMorgan alongside Jamie Dimon in 2004.
    • Previously: Dimon says he has curable throat cancer
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 5 Comments
  • UAL

    Weak day for airline stocks after Delta warns on global capacity

    • Airline stocks are showing weakness after sector leader Delta disappoints with its report on June PRASM.
    • The sector was due for a little bit of a blowoff, according to many industry insiders. Delta's stance that global capacity is on the rise provided the spark.
    • Decliners: United Continental (NASDAQ:UAL) -5.4%, Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) -4.7%, American Airlines Group (NASDAQ:AAL) -3.0%, Allegiant Travel (NASDAQ:ALGT) -2.9%, Hawaiian Holdings (NASDAQ:HA) -2.2%, JetBlue Airways (NASDAQ:JBLU) -2.0%, Alaska Air Group (NYSE:ALK) -2.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 14 Comments
  • BAC

    More on Deutsche's upgrade of Bank of America

    • Key to analyst Matt O'Connor's upgrade of Bank of America (BAC +2.5%) is his improved outlook for fixed income trading revenue. The whole world knows about the slowdown in this segment for the big banks, and expectations can hardly get any worse.
    • Following what is sure to be an ugly print for Q2 results, the year-over-year comparisons begin to get a lot easier, notes O'Connor.
    • Other catalysts: An improved M&A environment, higher interest rates, an improving economy, and finally, a Republican sweep in November could prove a boon for the entire banking sector.
    • Previously: BofA boosted by upgrade
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 8 Comments
  • CRTO

    Criteo +4.4% on BNP Paribas launch

    • BNP Paribas has started coverage on Criteo (NASDAQ:CRTO) with an Outperform and $52 PT.
    • Shares of the French ad retargeting platform provider are still down 41% from a March high of $60.95. They respectively go for 7.6x and 5.8x 2014E and 2015E sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • FPI

    Farmland Partners files to $57.5M of stock

    • IPOd just three months ago with a 3.8M share offering, Farmland Partners (FPI -0.8%) files to sell another $57.5M worth of stock, about 4.4M shares at the current price.
    • SEC Form S-11
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • LEU

    USEC stages another day of strong activity, tripling in two days

    • USEC (USU +25.5%) extends yesterday's huge gains following news of $2.5M in new funding from the Department of Energy; shares have dropped off early morning gains of as much as 65% but have more than tripled since the announcement.
    • A Seeking Alpha blog says the $2.5M influx moves the needle very little in the context of refinancing $530M of bonds outstanding, and that the stock soon will revert to fundamental valuation; post-reorganization, with convertible note holders taking the lion's share of value, equity holders will be left with less than 5% of the current trading value of the stock.
    • Uranium peers are mostly higher: URRE +8.8%, URG +5%, UUUU +2.8%, URZ +2.7%, DNN +1.5%, UEC flat.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 4 Comments
  • DAL

    Delta Air Lines slides after revenue metric disappoints

    • Delta Air Lines (DAL -4.8%) reports passenger revenue per available seat mile rose 4.5% in June. Expectations for the metric were higher for the month.
    • The carrier notes capacity increases in the industry and lower Latin America business demand due to the World Cup impacted results.
    • Q2 guidance from Delta is for operating margin of 14%-16% and for a 6% gain in passenger unit revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • TEF

    EU clears Telefonica/E-Plus deal

    • As expected, the EU has cleared Telefonica's (TEF -1.1%) $12B acquisition of German rival E-Plus from KPN (OTCPK:KKPNY) following a series of concessions.
    • E-Plus and Telefonica's O2 Deutschland (OTCPK:TELDF) unit are promising to rent out up to 30% of the combined company's network capacity, divest some spectrum, and extend existing wholesale and 4G broadband resale deals to any service provider interested in them.
    • The EU expects the concessions to spawn the creation of up to 3 new MVNOs, and thus keep competition healthy even as the number of German mobile networks gets cut to 3.
    • The clearance is expected to fuel further mobile M&A activity on the continent. EU antitrust chief Joaquin Almunia has argued cutting roaming fees and enabling cross-border services is more important for industry health than having 4 carriers in a market.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • VSI

    Reaction to Kroger's purchase of Vitacost.com

    • Shares of Vitamin Shoppe (VSI -1.9%) and GNC Holdings (GNC -0.8%) slip lower in what appears to be a reaction to competitive threat posed by the acquisition of Vitacost.com (VITC +27.1%) by Kroger (KR -0.2%).
    • Retail analysts think deal looks like a strategic fit for Kroger with the e-commerce platform and linked fulfillment centers form Vitacost giving it plenty of new growth channels.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural proposes Casablanca get three seats on reconstituted board

    • Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +5.1%) proposes a settlement with Casablanca Capital, where the hedge fund would receive three seats on a reconstituted CLF board consisting of nine directors.
    • CLF says a new board chairman will be elected regardless of whether Casablanca accepts the settlement offer.
    • If Casablanca does not accept, CLF says its board would remain at 11 members, and the company believes at least two of Casablanca's nominees would be elected.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 6 Comments
  • GPRO

    GoPro sees profit-taking; Ambarella higher on Garmin report

    • After skyrocketing during its first 4 trading days, GoPro (GPRO -9.8%) is selling off hard today. Shares still +54% from an opening trade of $28.65.
    • Nonetheless, Ambarella (AMBA +3.1%) is adding to its recent GoPro/Dropcam-fueled gains following a Dougherty report stating the company is set to replace CSR (CSRE +4.2%) as the video processor supplier for Garmin's (GRMN +0.9%) Virb action camera (competes against GoPro).
    • Garmin admitted on its Q1 CC (transcript) early Virb sales haven't met expectations, and that "the existence of entrenched competitors in this market is a factor." The company is counting on a product refresh and higher promotional spend to change its fortunes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 6 Comments
  • BZH

    Beazer Homes slides after downgrade

    • Sterne Agee downgrades Beazer Homes (BZH -1.9%) to Neutral.
    • Previously: American Homes 4 Rent purchases Beazer's rental homes unit
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave +4% on H.C. Wainwright upgrade

    • Citing strong top-line growth potential, boutique i-bank H.C. Wainwright has upgraded DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) to Buy, and set a $3 PT.
    • Shares are close to their 2014 highs. They rallied last Friday on a CIBC upgrade, and the day before that on a bullish SA Pro column.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • ISLE

    Buyout talk lifts Isle of Capri

    • Shares of Isle of Capri (ISLE +9.3%) pop on talk Game and Leisure (GLPI +2.3%) will make a run to acquire the casino operator.
    • Deutsche Bank is throwing some gas on the buyout fire, calling the math behind a combination of the two companies on the "powerful" side.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • WBMD

    WebMD +5.4% on Stifel upgrade

    • Stifel's Steven Rubis has upgraded WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) to Buy, and set a $60 PT.
    • Rubis: "Our upgrade stems from strong industry macro trends and our view that current estimates for 3Q14 and 4Q14 advertising revenue growth are likely conservative." He now forecasts 10% Y/Y ad growth for both Q3 and Q4, up from prior estimates of 8% and 5%. Consensus is at 10.3% and 8%.
    • Rubis adds macro trends and company-specific ad trends point to "solid" Q2 results, and thinks the Q2 report could be accompanied by a 2014 guidance hike.
    • Roughly a quarter of the float was shorted as of June 13.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • TSLA

    SCTY, SUNE, SPWR, CSIQ, RGSE, up on Canaccord launches

    • Canaccord has launched coverage on SolarCity (SCTY +4.4%),  SunEdison (SUNE +1.2%), Canadian Solar (CSIQ +2.3%), and RGS Energy (RGSE +4.7%) with Buy ratings.
    • SunPower (SPWR +0.6%) is up slightly in spite of being started at Hold.
    • Canaccord's Josh Baribeau predicts the solar industry as a whole will benefit as "financial innovation such as risk pooling, securitization, de-levering etc. continue to drive the costs of capital and system costs downward."
    • Baribeau expects SolarCity ($94 PT, leading the securitization trend) to beat Street deployment estimates, and to see strong cash flow growth with the help of declining component and financing costs.
    • He likes Canadian's low manufacturing costs, industry-leading commercial backlog, and relatively low Chinese sales dependence. His target is $43, or 10x 2015E EPS.
    • Solar ETFs: KWT, TAN
    • Previous: Deutsche upbeat on solar YieldCo potential
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent +5.1% on JPMorgan upgrade

    • Citing a favorable valuation following its recent selloff, JPMorgan has upgraded Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) to Overweight.
    • Prior to the upgrade, the telecom equipment vendor's shares had fallen 20% YTD. They go for 0.96x 2014E sales after factoring net debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 4 Comments
  • ORAN

    Orange -3.9% as company abandons French M&A plans

    • Orange (NYSE:ORAN) "has examined the possibilities of participating in an operation that would lead to consolidation in the French telecoms market, and believes that it cannot pursue this avenue at the present time as the conditions that the Group has set have not been met."
    • A source tells Reuters rival Bouygues (OTCPK:BOUYY -2.2%) was seeking too high of a price, and that 3-way talks that also included upstart carrier Iliad (to soothe antitrust concerns) are over.
    • Investors were hoping Orange would strike a deal cutting the number of French mobile carriers to 3, and in doing so cool off an intense price war launched by Iliad. The French government (owns 27% of Orange) backed the effort.
    • Previous: Orange falls on report of stalled Bouygues/Iliad talks
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: VITC +27%. USU +18%. SFLY +14%. ISLE +14%. ZGNX +14%. URRE +9%. STEM +9%. DRWI +9%. GBX +8%. CASI +8%. RAX +7%. STZ +6%. RGSE +6%.
    • Losers: CAMP -13%. MCP -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • GBX

    Greenbrier +8.3% after strong Q3, upsized forecast

    • Greenbrier (NYSE:GBX) +8.3% premarket after raising its full-year earnings forecast and easily beating FQ3 earnings expectations.
    • The railcar manufacturer says FQ3 revenues rose 18.1% Q/Q, primarily due to increased deliveries, and gross margins were 16.3% from 11.5% in Q2, driven by improved efficiencies, pricing and product mix; railcar backlog as of the end of Q3 was 26,400 units valued ~$2.75B vs. 15,200 units valued at ~$1.54B at the end of Q2.
    • Issues upside guidance for FY 2014, now expecting EPS of $2.98-$3.08 vs. its prior forecast of $2.45-$2.70 and analyst consensus estimate of $2.62, and revenues of more than $2.2B vs. $2.16B consensus.
    • For Q4, GBX sees EPS of $0.95-$1.05 vs. $0.87 consensus, and deliveries of 4,300-4,600 units resulting in full-year deliveries of 15,700-16,000 units.
    • TRN +3.3% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • URBN

    Analysis: Urban Outfitters beckons at current valuation

    • Macquarie upgrades Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) to Outperform from Neutal on a valuation call after shares drifted to a 52-week low.
    • SA contributor The Value Investor also has Urban Outfitters lined up as a long-term investment opportunity due to its favorable growth trajectory.
    • URBN +1.0% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • SFLY

    Bloomberg: Shutterfly shopping itself

    • Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) is working with Qatalyst Partners to find potential buyers, sources tell Bloomberg.
    • P-E firms and web storage companies are on the list of prospective acquirers.
    • Earlier: Shutterfly pops off of sale chatter
    • SFLY +13.1% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM

  • Treasurys lower after ADP jobs beat

    • The 10-year Treasury yield pops higher by three basis points to 2.59% after ADP reports private job gains of 281K in June vs. 213K expected. May's 179K gain remains so, but earlier months saw a mix of revisions.
    • TLT -0.4%, TBT +0.8% premarket
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, SHY, IEF, TBF, PST, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, TLH, SBND, IEI, TYO, DLBS, DTYS, VGLT, BIL, UBT, UST, SHV, VGIT, TBX, TLO, VGSH, SCHO, GSY, TENZ, DTYL, SCHR, ITE, LBND, TYD, SST, TYBS, DTUS, DTUL, TUZ, TBZ, DLBL, DFVL, FIVZ, DFVS, TYNS
    • Full report
     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM | 7 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp -11.7%, Seeking Alpha blog says shares worth $1.60

    • Molycorp (MCP) -11.7% pre-market after a negative Seeking Alpha blog claims MCP could run out of cash by Q1 2015 without a capital raise.
    • MCP needs to raise ~$260M in additional capital in order to sustain itself, according to blogger New York Shock Exchange, who values the company at $1.60/share vs. the current $2.57 price.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • RAX

    Rackspace soars on going-private report

    • Rackspace (NYSE:RAX) is in talks with a P-E firm about a deal to take the company private, reports TechCrunch, with an eye towards maybe making an official announcement this week.
    • "The pressures of being a public company are too much," says one source, and the idea of going private "has gained sufficient traction" in the boardroom.
    • The going-private leak comes amid at least three acquisition bids, says TC, including one from H-P (NYSE:HPQ) for up to $43 per share.
    • RAX +9.6% to $37 premarket
    • Previously: Rackspace falls on negative M&A report
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM
  • KR

    Kroger acquires Vitacost.com

    • Kroger (NYSE:KR) agrees to buy Vitacost.com (NASDAQ:VITC) for $8 per share in a $280M deal.
    • The transaction is expected to close in Q3.
    • Vitacost.com will operate as a subsidiary of Kroger and beef up the grocery store operator's e-commerce presence considerably.
    • VITC +20.4% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly pops on chatter of sale

    • Shares of Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) fly high in early trading with some chatter that the company is looking to sell itself driving momentum.
    • There is talk that an upcoming Bloomberg scoop will indicate Shutterfly has hired Qatalyst to assist it in the sales process.
    • SFLY +10.5% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • STZ

    Strong beer demand lifts Constellations Brands

    • Shares of Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) move higher in premarket action after the company records a healthy FQ1 earnings beat and lifts its guidance.
    • The beer segment saw sales increase 14% on strong volume numbers to help offset a minor dip in wine and spirits sales.
    • The company's operating margin improved to 26.5% during the quarter.
    • STZ +6.9% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • STZ

    Constellation Brands beats by $0.14, beats on revenue

    • Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ): Q1 EPS of $1.07 beats by $0.14.
    • Revenue of $1.53B (+127.2% Y/Y) beats by $100M.
    • Shares +7.5% PM.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM
  • OHI

    Healthcare REIT sector downgraded by Goldman

    • Citing a preference for more economically-sensitive REIT sectors, Goldman downgrades the Healthcare REIT sector to Neutral from Attractive. Alongside the sector cut, the team downgrades Omega Healthcare Investors (NYSE:OHI) to Neutral. It's off 1% premarket.
    • Among the other names in the sector: HCN, HCP, MPW, HTA, SNH, VTR, LTC, AVIV.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 AM | 17 Comments
